intro: Euphrasia virgata, commonly known as the common eyebright, is a flowering plant native to Europe, Asia, and North Africa. It belongs to the family Scrophulariaceae and is characterized by its small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant typically grows in moist, calcareous soils and can be found in meadows, woodland edges, and along stream banks. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are erect and branched. Euphrasia virgata is known for its medicinal properties and has been traditionally used to treat eye ailments and respiratory conditions.
